com.jcabi.jdbc

Interface Outcome<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of expected result
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColumnOutcome, ListOutcome, SingleOutcome

    public interface Outcome<T>
    Outcome of ResultSet.

    The following convenience implementations are provided:

    • NOT_EMPTY to check that at least one result row is returned.
    • VOID for when you wish to disregard the result.
    • UPDATE_COUNT to check the number of updated rows.
    Since:
    0.12
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Carlos Miranda (miranda.cma@gmail.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Outcome<Long> LAST_INSERT_ID
      Outcome that returns last insert ID.
      static Outcome<Boolean> NOT_EMPTY
      Returns TRUE if at least one SQL record found in ResultSet.
      static Outcome<Integer> UPDATE_COUNT
      Outcome that returns the number of updated rows.
      static Outcome<Void> VOID
      Outcome that does nothing (and always returns null).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T handle(ResultSet rset, Statement stmt)
      Process the result set and return some value.

    • Field Detail

      • NOT_EMPTY

        static final Outcome<Boolean> NOT_EMPTY
        Returns TRUE if at least one SQL record found in ResultSet.

        The outcome returns the value of ResultSet.next() and throws SQLException in case of a problem.

        Since:
        0.12

      • VOID

        static final Outcome<Void> VOID
        Outcome that does nothing (and always returns null).

        Useful when you're not interested in the result: 

         new JdbcSession(source)
   .sql("INSERT INTO foo (name) VALUES (?)")
   .set("Jeff Lebowski")
   .insert(Outcome.VOID);
        Since:
        0.12

      • UPDATE_COUNT

        static final Outcome<Integer> UPDATE_COUNT
        Outcome that returns the number of updated rows.

        Use it when you need to determine the number of rows updated: 

         Integer count = new JdbcSession(source)
   .sql("UPDATE employee SET salary = 35000 WHERE department = ?")
   .set("Finance")
   .update(Outcome.UPDATE_COUNT);
        Since:
        0.12

      • LAST_INSERT_ID

        static final Outcome<Long> LAST_INSERT_ID
        Outcome that returns last insert ID.

        Use it when you need to get last insert ID from INSERT: 

         long id = new JdbcSession(source)
   .sql("INSERT INTO employee (name) VALUES (?)")
   .set("Jeffrey")
   .insert(Outcome.LAST_INSERT_ID);
        Since:
        0.13

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        T handle(ResultSet rset,
       Statement stmt)
         throws SQLException
        Process the result set and return some value.
        Parameters:
        rset - The result set to process
        stmt - The statement used in the run
        Returns:
        The result
        Throws:
        SQLException - If something goes wrong inside
